author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 880, 'last_played': 1705776290}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand—the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed—the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1682183630}
review:
Spoids is a very poorly made 2D retro pixel/minimalist console ported tower defense game.   Gameplay consists of very basic placement of a variety of minimalist pixel turrets on an established grid, letting them kill everything, then uninstalling the game because you're not a console peasant and thus don't enjoy console trash that didn't even do well on consoles, which certainly raises questions about why such trash is on PC. 

From a technical perspective, the game doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

A choice was made to use obsolete, decades old retro pixel "art" as a substitute for contemporary PC graphics.  It's unclear if this is due to lack of budget or talent, regardless, the overall visual quality of the game is extremely low as a result.

The developers didn't design the game for modern gaming PCs, as such the display resolution caps out at around 1080p, a very low resolution that became mainstream back in 2006 and became obsolete when 4K entered the mainstream in 2014.  Now, the game did come out in 2012, but there's no excuse for the developers choosing not to repair this defect before dumping it on Steam as a cash grab in 2017.  The game simply won't look right on modern gaming displays due to this failure on the part of the developers.

Because this is a console game, it carries a number of deliberate design deficiencies.  Compromises were made to cater to the inferior console gaming appliances that the game was designed for.  These are unfortunate compromises and limitations that PC gamers shouldn't be forced to accept, but it's evident that PC was a second thought for the console-centric developers.  The game is deficient as a result of these choices, and would have been so much better without the handicaps that designing games for consoles forces upon a game.  Once more, console peasants have made gaming worse for everyone.

Some of the defects in the game can be attributed to the choice of using the video game construction kit/toolset, Microsoft XNA Game Studio.  This is a very poor quality toolset sometimes used by amateur/unskilled developers as it doesn't require advanced game development skills, but unfortunately has very limited capabilities.  Just as you can't make a silk purse out of a sows ear, you can't make a great video game if you use a terrible engine.

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

You don't have to take my word about how bad the game is, we can measure the interest in a game by how much people bothered to play it.  Spoids has achievements, and they show us a very clear picture that the game absolutely failed to capture any interest from gamers.  The most commonly and easily attained achievement is for completing the tutorial, but less than 3 percent of players bothered to get that far before uninstalling the game.  That's a tiny, tiny proportion of gamers who even bothered with this.  Ouch.

Reviewing SteamDB to check how popular this game was with players reveals a surprise... there's a very healthy spike in player counts for the game.  But this isn't consistent with the achievement stats, that show only 2.5 percent of players bothered playing the game for any reasonable amount of time.  How is it possible for this game to have so many concurrent players who weren't even playing the game?  Trading cards.  Players will use card idling software to collect the cards and sell them, but this won't trigger any achievements in-game.  That tells us people only really bought this game for trading cards, and that's a damning indictment of the woeful quality.  A closer look at the numbers shows the game just has a couple of players every week running up the game and idling it for cards, then deleting it.  We must ask how it benefits gamers for there to be so many games like this, with no merit as a serious game, that only generate sales from people idling and selling the trading cards.

Spoids is relatively cheap at 90 cents, but it's not worth it. Given the defects and quality issues with the game, coupled with the unrealistic price, this is impossible to recommend.

Solo para fans del genero TD

author: {'steamid': '76561197985603115', 'num_games_owned': 420, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1643856357}
review:
This is the first TD game I've played where you HAVE to place tons of towers. No tower upgrading, a tower is what it is. Unfortunately, it makes the game super hard and while I was able to do the first 4 levels, on the 5th level, I can only get bronze despite many many attempts. 

The voice acting on some of the levels is super annoying - I finally just turned sound off because of that. 

This game is dead - the forums are dead, hardly anyone ever played this which is a shame because I do think this could be good with a few tweaks. I'm struggling how to to rate it because I definitely won't finish it and in my book that says its just too hard (I have played probably 80% of all the TD games out there so this is not my first rodeo). 

If you can get it on sale, go for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199227258706', 'num_games_owned': 1483, 'num_reviews': 666, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1640448486}

author: {'steamid': '76561198079317183', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1642859263}
review:
There are opportunities for improvement in this game.
The most important one is the user interface itself; choosing towers by mouse wheel is something I had never seen and hope to never see again. The targeting algorithm of the towers also needs work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198796851430', 'num_games_owned': 927, 'num_reviews': 3722, 'playtime_forever': 6184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6184, 'last_played': 1651369060}
review:
这款球体冒险游戏，初看之下或许因其独特的球体主角和简洁的画风吸引了一部分玩家的注意。然而在我实际体验过这款游戏后，发现其存在不少令人失望之处。

首先从核心玩法上来看显得过于简单且重复。游戏中玩家主要控制一个球体在各种环境中冒险，通过跳跃和躲避障碍来通关。然而这些关卡设计缺乏新意，难度曲线也过于平缓，导致整个游戏过程显得单调乏味。玩家在游玩不久后就可能感到厌倦，缺乏继续探索的动力。

其次游戏的画面和音效也未能给人留下深刻印象。虽然球体主角的设计简约可爱，但整体画面缺乏细节和质感，场景和障碍物也显得较为单调。音效方面同样令人失望，背景音乐单调乏味，与游戏场景和氛围的契合度不高，无法为玩家带来沉浸式的游戏体验。

此外游戏的剧情和角色塑造也显得相当薄弱。游戏并未为玩家提供一个引人入胜的故事背景，球体主角也缺乏足够的个性和特点，使得整个游戏过程缺乏情感共鸣和代入感。玩家很难对游戏中的角色和故事产生深厚的情感联系。

最后从性价比的角度来看同样令人感到失望。相较于其他同类游戏，它在玩法、画面、音效、剧情等方面都显得较为逊色，但价格却并不低廉。这使得玩家在购买时可能会感到不值，尤其是对于期待高质量游戏体验的玩家来说，这款游戏可能并不是一个明智的选择。

综上所述，这款游戏在多个方面都未能满足玩家的期待。如果你对游戏的玩法深度和丰富性要求较高，或者希望寻找一款更具挑战性和趣味性的冒险游戏，那么这款游戏可能并不适合你。希望开发者能够在未来的作品中认真倾听玩家的反馈，不断改进和完善游戏的设计，为玩家带来更好的游戏体验。

author: {'steamid': '76561198413923800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1602768296}
review:
This was one of those games I picked up on special and promptly forgot about it. It's a day before the new Kingdom rush comes out... went through my list of unplayed games and loaded this up for a quick spin...

It's a quick decent tower defense game. It'll take  two to three hours for an experienced TD player to get through. From what I could tell, it's bug free. It's not too easy and not too hard.

It's not perfect and there's plenty of places where it could be improved. Some sort of progression or tech tree where there's an incentive to do well on maps and go back to maps where you didn't get a perfect score etc. An easy/medium/hard version would also have been good.. oh, and the obvious, more maps would be nice. There's only about 7 maps.

It does have infinite mode, but I found there's no incentive to care.

Overall, grab it while on a deep discount and play for a few hours one night.

author: {'steamid': '76561198295906992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1599900148}

author: {'steamid': '76561198192669385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1562434285}
review:
An und für sich ist das Spiel nicht schlecht. Es ist aber unnötig schwer und zwar so das man die Missionen etliche male wiederholen muss um zu wissen was das Spiel von einem will. 2 oder 3 mal meinetwegen auch 5 oder 10 mal die gleiche Karte Spielen finde ich ja noch Ok aber alles darüber weg ist Ätzen. 

Es ist einfach immer wieder das gleiche und die Karte mit Türmen zu müllen in der Hoffnung das es dieses mal klappt nervt auf Dauer. Leider ist es nicht möglich ein klares Konzept zu Verfolgen um so einen guten Aufbau  zu bekommen. Es ist viel mehr ein rantasten und gucken wo jemand durch kommt, um dann wieder dieses Loch zu flicken darf man wieder von vorne anfangen und irgendwo Geld sparen um dann an besagter Stelle einen Turm zu bauen. Dumm nur das dann das ganze Konzept vom Anfang auch wieder hinfällig ist.
 

Deswegen keine Empfehlung von mir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198804535389', 'num_games_owned': 577, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1516787010}
review:
入門用タワーディフェンスとして作られたのではないかというくらいシンプルな内容。通路へ侵入してくる敵に対してアップグレードできないタワーをひたすら並べて迎撃するだけ。エンドレスモードでは全てのマスへタワーを設置したらあとは眺めているだけだった。

セール時なら値段相応ともいえるが、定価ではかなり割高と思える。タワーディフェンス好きなら、遊んで損はないだろうけど……

唯一、大量に並べたタワーが侵入した敵へ一斉に攻撃する様は見ていて爽快感があった。

author: {'steamid': '76561198006521459', 'num_games_owned': 343, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 1505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1081, 'last_played': 1704292408}
review:
This is actually a fun tower defense game. One downside, or plus depending on your point of view, each campaing mission has a set wave enemy generation and direction, so you can plan ahead if you play a mission over.

The music is repetative and so are the voice overs. Each enemy unit takes more damage each wave, so what once worked gets swarmed by increasingly useless damaging turrets.

You can designate what individual turrets do, such as target nearest to turret, closest to exit/entrance, weakest, strongest, fastest or slowest. Giving you a more custom targeting setup, since default behavior targeting is a bit awful.

If you strive for platinum on each mission, it can get intense.

Overally I think the game is challenging and addictive when you strive for perfection. (No enemies make it through)

author: {'steamid': '76561198001664644', 'num_games_owned': 4436, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1699311640}

author: {'steamid': '76561198024050400', 'num_games_owned': 506, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 1680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 901, 'last_played': 1511311342}
review:
Another TD to scratch the itch.  Wish the dev would release more maps, or put up an online leaderboard (this keeps pros trying to perfect strategies).

Sadly I didn't know this game was released half a year ago, and I often looked at 'Tower Defense' genre in Steam.  Maybe because this game wasn't popular, so Steam hid it from me >_<

Another wish is for keyboard shortcuts to build towers.  Since there's no pause, if we're reacting to the aliens, it would be quicker to plonk towers down without having to scroll through the tower list.

Good TD 7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169827089', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1593583984}

author: {'steamid': '76561198026919171', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1504500125}
review: I bought this game when it was on sale for $0.49. This purchase represents a despicable moment in my life where neither pleasure nor pain existed, but instead merged in some sort of untennable limbo. I hate this game. I hate every aspect of it, and every person related to its creation. From the trailer trash commando to the nightwalking harlot who poorly portrays the CPU, I truly hope that karma is real so that these pieces of writhing, human filth will pay for what they created. Fuck you Spoids staff. You people should be ashamed of yourselves. I won't even return it so that it can be a token of my trauma and a personal warning that I may never tread down such a path the rest of my days. Un-fucking-acceptable. 1/5

author: {'steamid': '76561197971403806', 'num_games_owned': 1469, 'num_reviews': 257, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1504773341}
review:
I can not believe I got this game for under $1.

* Controller support +rumble.
* Tutorials and messages are both audio and text. 
* Simplistic graphics remind me of early multi-colored vector arcade games (I think there where only like 8 of them).

Great for new , and veterain TD players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038597623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1503932031}
review:
Not really bad, but short and doesn't offer anything new on the the crowded TD market.
A decent base, but need more variations in gameplay. Can't recommend in its current state.
Compelted in 8 hours

Pros:
+ technically well done for a indie title, nothing stunning but  doesn't look amateurish.
+ low price.

Cons:
- lack of contents, only 8 levels including tutorial, endless mode doesn't offer a lot.
- only half of the levels offer a real challenge.
- lack of diversity, you start with 3 towers on lvl 1 and only get one new tower per level.
- nothing new gameplay wise, only 8 towers with no upgrade, no special power, no mazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071094464', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1503981661}

review: Well done TD game.  Can't miss at this price point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063324351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1499250579}
review:
シンプルなタワーディフェンスゲームとしてやり応えを感じた。
射程は長いけど攻撃力が低い、攻撃力が高いが若干射程が劣るといったタワーを駆使して撃破していく。
動きを遅くするEMPで素早い敵を倒し易くしたり、レーダーで捕捉しなければ攻撃もままならない敵もいる。
壁面全部を埋め尽くすタワーは壮観で結構気持ちよくプレイ出来た。
難易度的には完全コンプリートするなら大変だろうが大体2時間程度で現行のアップデート状況でクリアが出来た。

英語はからっきし・・・といった具合の人でもプレイしながら覚えるいけると思われる。
EDITモードといった物も追加されれば深みが増すかも知れない。
値段もリーズナブルで、やり込み要素としてのエンドレスモードもあるんで限界にチャレンジするといった事も良いかも知れない。

author: {'steamid': '76561198048002363', 'num_games_owned': 275, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1588536221}
review: now that is doesn't stutter every 5 seconds. I still think the lame voice acting and boring gameplay isn't enough. especially for 2$ lol is the whole objective just to cover every space with a tower? the gameplay is lacking and overall feel of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141499183', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1493542700}
review:
説明不要なくらいスタンダードなＴＤ。
タワーの種類は通常タレット、貫通タレット、スロー、レーダー、貫通ビーム、対空ミサイル・・・などなど、けっこう豊富。
アップグレード要素はない。
キャンペーンモードは１ステージ１０分前後。難易度はKingdom rush等に比べるとやや高め。
エンドレスモードは全ステージにあり。

特徴といえば、
敵もタワーも大量に建てれる（サンプル画像の通り）ので、弾幕が派手。
右下に激戦区のハイライトみたいな映像が出る（ゲームプレイに影響はなし）
フルボイス。

半額セール１００円で買ったが、２００円でも損はしないと思う。

４・２９追記

キャンペーンをクリア。
クリアまで２時間。２００円だから仕方がないかもしれないが、かなり短かった。
エンドレスモードをプレイすればもっと遊べるとは思うが、
値段とプレイ時間が見合うかどうかは、個々の判断にゆだねます。

author: {'steamid': '76561197996944307', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1493643543}
review:
I could tell you what it is, but rather than that, I tell you what it's not:
[list] 
[*] It's not any kind of Farming simulator and putting that in mind it hasn't even a single recognisable animal in the game. A real pity. Just Sad.
[*] Also, its not a Shooter and I can't annoy everyone with my brilliant taste of music. That's a big minus.
[*] And Last but not least it's not a shitty Tower defence. It has no unfair balance and no extra ordinary graphic, too. It does not collect my data against my will and sell it to someone and finally, I couldn't notice anything annoyable in it. A real shame.
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561197962500440', 'num_games_owned': 863, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1491157232}
review:
Came for the old school tower defense experience.

Stayed for the amazing Russian accent.

For your money you probably won't find a better deal in the tower defense genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974275923', 'num_games_owned': 9623, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1695654189}
review:
[b]A fun oldschool TD.[/b]

Above average presentation and an attractive minimalist yet colourful aesthetic combine to make a cheap TD game that is a cut above the rest in this price range. 

I wish the towers could be upgraded but other than that I have no complaints. 

Well worth it at this price point. (£1. 59)

Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992575759', 'num_games_owned': 7837, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1488491598}
review:
Bardzo przyjemna gra tower defense która:
- nie jest klonem Defense Grid
- nie jest klonem Kingdom Rush
- nie wymaga wielogodzinnego grindu
- ma full voice acting
- wymaga stosowania przemyślanej strategii
- nie kosztuje zbyt dużo

author: {'steamid': '76561197983740996', 'num_games_owned': 746, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1487978678}
review:
Spoids is a fine tower defence game that only has eight levels but therefore is inexpensive and still a lot of fun to play. Although you can't upgrade towers this does not diminish the joy. The difficulty is very well balanced. You can gain medals for each level from bronze to platinum and while bronze is easy, platinum is really hard, especially in level 5 and 6. 

Pros: 
- nice graphics
- very good balance between towers and enemies
- runs smooth and without bugs
- well designed maps
- interesting voice acting, you can tell it's done by amateurs. While some do great, especially the lady in the credits, others sound like being forced to lecture aloud before class. But that's fun too.
- good music
- very cool credits
- endless mode
- full controller support
- it even has a story

Cons:
- missing leader-boards

author: {'steamid': '76561198031180632', 'num_games_owned': 593, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1488028553}
review:
Ein kurzes und schönes 2D-Retro Tower Defense ohne Grinding.

Auch heute noch sind die meisten TDs strategich nur zweidimensional, versuchen aber durch Grafiktricks einen 3D-Eindruck zu erwecken. Flugeinheiten, Turmbauplätze mit Reichenweitenbonus oder Ähnliches unterstützen diesen Eindruck.
Dieses Spiel hat eine gelungene 2D-Retrografik. Die Maps passen auf einen Bildschirm und sind relativ einfach gestrickt, es gibt vorgebene Mauern die den Weg der Gegner bestimmen und auf denen überall Türme gebaut werden dürfen.
Es kann mehrere Eingänge und Ausgänge geben, nicht alle Gegner nehmen unbedingt den gleichen Weg.
Man kann den  Weg der Gegner nicht beeinflussen und es gibt keine Rückspulfunktion. Flugeinheiten ignorieren die Mauern und haben ihre eigenen Wege.

Es gibt keine direkten Schwierigkeitgrade, sondern 3 Ziele, die jeweils nach einer bestimmten Anzahl überlebten Wellen erfüllt sind. Je nach erreichter Welle erhält man Bronze, Silber oder Gold. Hat man alle 3 Ziele erreicht und noch alle 20 Leben, so gibt es Platin. Es gibt eine Beschleunigungsfunktion (mittlere Maustaste gedrückt halten). Da die Wellen in den Missionen in kurzen Abständen starten, bekämpft man meistens mehrere Wellen und braucht sie seltener. 

Eine Vorschau, zeigt die Embleme der nächsten Gegner.
Es gibt 8 Türme ohne Upgradestufen und mit einstellbaren Zielprioritäten.
Die 8 Missionen kann man in 2h durchgespielt haben.

[u]Fazit[/u]
Schön gemachter Retrocharme der Spass macht. Ich habe es kostenlos über einen Freund erhalten und für den aktuellen Angebotspreis von 1,49€ ist es schon kurz.

Mehr Empfehlungen (hauptsächlich Tower Defense Spiele):
http://store.steampowered.com/curator/8896126-Gametests-and-Videos
